column4: I tried looking it up on the internet but couldn't find anything, is there a way to resize my ubuntu partion or do i have to reinstall?
you can download an ISO disc image you can burn and boot from, and it will let you resize the partitions.
thanks, um do you have or link or will google do it and/ is there a way also to merge partions beause i think i have some free space not used
you can delete partitions and merge the space, depending on where it is on the disk.  ultimately yes, possible.  I don't have a URL but google will find it easily.
Thanks. I got it but if i don't have a disc is there a way to do it on an operating system (mac or linux) or must i use a seperate bootable thing
you can do it on a running Linux system, it's just more dangerous.
and I imagine it's possible to install it on a bootable USB flash drive.
How much space? I don't have a very big usb at the moment
and dangerous? meaning lose of data possible?
possible.  not likely, but possible.  far less likely if you boot from the parted CD.
Can i install it on my disk as a seperate partion?
there's a channel on here about it.  #parted ... and theoretically you could install a Linux system on a spare partition and resize the other partitions, but that's getting complex.
ill join the parted channel thanks
they could give you much more direction than I could I suspect.  one option is to borrow an external CD or DVD drive though.  they're pretty cheap.  handy for installing OSes on netbooks too. :)
the parted channel is quiet, no one is responded
I didn't know how busy it was.  but be patient, someone might eventually respond.
no i mean know one there is active: all afk/idle
be patient.  often people show up hours later and see your question, and respond.
